samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-app-settings
samples.title: App settings web part
samples.description: This sample shows how AppSettings.ts file can be added and used within SharePoint Framewrok webparts similar to the Web.config / App.config key value app settings in .NET Framework projects. That allows better DevOps and continuous integration (CI/CD) automation. The AppSettings.ts is transpiled/compiled with your SPFx solution which differs from the way the web.config. With .Net web.config file we would be able to update independently without the need of compiling DLLs. If that behavior is required, you can store your app settings in a SharePoint list and change them from there. However, that will have performance degradation over if the setting was part of the SPFx code where the logic can get a setting value in milliseconds.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-content-query-online
samples.title: Content Query Web Part (SharePoint Online)
samples.description: The React Content Query Web Part is a modern version of the good old Content by Query Web Part that was introduced in SharePoint 2007. Built for SharePoint Online, this modern version is built against the new SharePoint Framework (SPFx) and uses the latest Web Stack practices. While the original Web Part was based on a XSLT templating engine, this React Web Part is based on the well known Handlebars templating engine, which empowers users to create simple, yet powerfull HTML templates for rendering the queried content. This new version also lets the user query any site collections which resides on the same domain url, add unlimited filters, query DateTime fields to the nearest minute rather than being limited to a day, and much more.

Built for SharePoint 2016 and Office 365, this modern version is built against the new SharePoint Framework (SPFx) and uses the latest Web Stack practices. While the original Web Part was based on a XSLT templating engine, this React Web Part is based on the well known Handlebars templating engine, which empowers users to create simple, yet powerfull HTML templates for rendering the queried content. This new version also lets the user query any site collections which resides on the same domain url, add unlimited filters, query DateTime fields to the nearest minute rather than being limited to a day, and much more.

Please note this is custom implementation of the Publish–subscribe pattern by using the ReactiveX (RxJs) library. The SPFx will nativelly support this in future without the need of custom implementation through new SPFx api called Event Aggregator, but it is still in Alpha.

samples.description: This SPFx web part (or Teams Tab) enables a user to upload a supported file type via drag and drop while the uploaded file will be converted as PDF

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-teams-lead-dashboard
samples.title: Lead Dashboard
samples.description: This sample shows how to use SPFx to create a Microsoft Teams dashboard personal app.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-teams-meeting-app-questionnaire
samples.title: Questionnaire Teams Meeting App
samples.description: Questionnaire meeting app provides Pre-meeting app experience for MS Teams meeting attendees to ask the questions related to meeting before the meeting starts.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-teams-membership-updater
samples.title: Teams Membership Updater
samples.description: Used to update the membership of a team based on the contents of a CSV file, can be hosted in a SharePoint site where a list can be defined for logging purposes or run inside teams as a personal app.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-teams-message
samples.title: React Teams Messages
samples.description: This is a sample web part that displays currently logged in user's Microsoft Teams(user is member of), its channels and will allow sending messages to any Team's channel.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-teams-message-user
samples.title: Message Teams User
samples.description: Sample that shows how to send a message to Microsoft Teams using a SharePoint framework solution using Microsoft Graph.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-teams-personal-app-settings
samples.title: Teams Personal App Settings Web Part
samples.description: Demonstrates how you can store Teams Personal App Web Part's properties in user's OneDrive.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-teams-send-notification
samples.title: Send Notifications in Teams
samples.description: This web part allows you to send MS Teams feed notifications to a selected user

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-teams-tab-field-visit-mashup
samples.title: Teams Tab - Field Visit Demo (Mashup)
samples.description: A web part for use in Microsoft Teams that displays a mashup of information partaining to customer visits.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-teams-tab-suggested-members
samples.title: Group members suggestion
samples.description: This web part uses Graph API to suggest you members to add to a group (based on People endpoint), so you can easily add those members to the Group / Teams. It can be used as a SharePoint web part or Teams tab

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-teams-tabs-pnpjs
samples.title: MS Teams Channels and Tabs from Modern Team site
samples.description: A SPFx Web Part using @pnp/graph/teams. It shows Channels and Tabs (with link) from a Modern Team Site connected to Microsoft Teams.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-teams-tagging
samples.title: Tag Teams using a TermSet in SharePoint
samples.description: This sample shows how read and update a custom Schema extension in MS Graph to Tag a Team using metadata from a specific TermSet in SharePoint.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-tenant-properties
samples.title: Tenant Properties Web Part
samples.description: This web part allows tenant administrators to manage tenant properties through a graphical interface. We can create, edit or delete tenant properties.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-themes
samples.title: SharePoint Themes Client Side Web Part
samples.description: This web part illustrates how to use SharePoint Theme variables in custom web parts.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-tiles
samples.title: Tiles
samples.description: This web part provides you the ability to add a per instance listing of tiled links. Tiles are stored as a collection of tiles within the web part's properties, removing the need for link storage within SharePoint lists, tenant properties, or other external link storage requirements.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-tiles-v2
samples.title: Tiles V2
samples.description: This solution creates a customizable Tiles Web part, it uses a stored collection from the PnP `PropertyFieldCollectionData` control and allows the user to choose the color scheme (theme or custom) and to set the size of the tiles.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-timeline
samples.title: Timeline
samples.description: This sample displays list of events in chronological order. It is typically a graphic design showing a long bar labelled with dates paralleling it, and coexisting events. This web part helps to draw the timeline based from SharePoint list with pre-defined schema.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-tinymce
samples.title: TinyMCE Editor Web Part Integration with SharePoint
samples.description: React TinyMCE is one of the worlds most popular editors for the web. It has many features out of the box and many more plugins that can be added when needed. You can create your own plugins if you want, the editor is powered by the communitiy.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-todo-basic
samples.title: Todo Basic
samples.description: A simple todo web part built using react to showcase some of the SharePoint Framework developer features, utilities and best practices in building react based web parts.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-tour-pnpjs
samples.title: Tour Sample
samples.description: A SPFx WebPart using PnP/PnPjs, @pnp/spfx-property-controls and ReactTourJS.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-tree-orgchart
samples.title: Tree Organization Web Part
samples.description: The Tree Organization Web Part shows the Organization Chart of the or the team, the web part reads information from current user to build the Organization Chart.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-twitter
samples.title: Twitter Timeline
samples.description: Sample web part to display Twitter timeline.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-upgrade-me
samples.title: Upgrade Me
samples.description: Use this web part to test the CLI for Microsoft 365 SPFx Project Upgrade.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-versiondisplay
samples.title: Displaying the version number in a web part
samples.description: This very simple sample demonstrates three different approaches to display the version number of your SharePoint solution in your web part.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-video-banner
samples.title: Video Banner
samples.description: Use this Web Part to add a video banner with a text on top of it to your pages.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-videolibrary
samples.title: Video Library
samples.description: A set of 3 SPFX webparts that use different open-source carousels (react-3d-carousel, reactjs-coverface, and react-slick) to display videos stored on an Office 365 Video Channel

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-visio
samples.title: Visio Embed
samples.description: This sample shows how the Visio JavaScript APIs can be used within a web part. For sample purposes, this web part will display the name and the hyperlinks of a Visio shape when the user selects it.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-weather-information
samples.title: Weather Information
samples.description: This web part provides you the ability to display basic weather information for one location on a web page. The web part depends on a service provided by Yahoo Weather API.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-webcam
samples.title: Web/Mobile Camera Demo
samples.description: This is sample web part to showcase how to open webcam and take photo in SPFx web part.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-webhooks-realtime
samples.title: Webhooks Realtime
samples.description: This web part demonstrates how to leverage the capabilities of SharePoint Webhooks. The libraries used by this web part are Socket.io, sp pnp js, moment.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-webpartdetails
samples.title: Web Part Details
samples.description: The web part illustrates how to get all the web part present in the current page, bind them in a multi-select dropdown.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-word-game
samples.title: Word Game
samples.description: A fun game where you unscramble the words before the time runs out. It stores everyone's high scores in a SharePoint List on the Site.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-world-clocks
samples.title: React World Clocks
samples.description: This sample is extension of the single World time clock sample that was provided in SP Starter Kit.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-world-time
samples.title: World Time
samples.description: This web part provides you the ability to display basic clock for a given time zone on a web page. The clock is based on the user's workstation time with an offset from UTC to the selected time zone.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-yammer-api
samples.title: Yammer REST API web part
samples.description: This sample shows how Yammer REST APIs can be consumed by using SharePoint Framework React web part and the Yammer JavaScript SDK. The SPFx web part contains wrapper around the Yammer JavaScript SDK that can be extended for fluent typescript api experience.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-yammer-praise
samples.title: Yammer Praise using aadTokenProvider
samples.description: This sample shows how to post a praise to Yammer using aadTokenProvider (without Yammer JavaScript SDK).

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-youtube
samples.title: Youtube Web Part
samples.description: This web part allows to search and view the Youtube videos, across the Youtube API, directly on a SharePoint page, furthermore the property panel offers the possibility to specify the api key, the number of items to display and it is also possible specify a Youtube Channel Id.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-zod
samples.title: Zod
samples.description: This sample shows the usage of Zod to eliminate manual cast and validation of the data coming from external API.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-zpl-viewer
samples.title: ZPL Viewer
samples.description: This web part will allow a user to select a text file contatining zpl which is used to generate an image using the labelary web service to render the zpl and return the image.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-riot-list
samples.title: List RiotJS Client-Side Web Part
samples.description: Simplistic sample Web Part that demonstrates the use of RiotJS in creating a SharePoint Framework web part.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-section-backgrounds
samples.title: Supporting section backgrounds in your web parts
samples.description: These samples show how to implement support for section backgrounds in your web parts.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-sharepoint-crud
samples.title: SharePoint CRUD operations
samples.description: Sample Web Parts illustrating performing SharePoint CRUD operations in React, Angular, JavaScript without any framework and using the @pnp/sp library.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-vue-js-org-chart
samples.title: VueJS Org Chart
samples.description: A simple Organisation Chart web part using Office UI Fabric, VueJS, REST API.

samples.name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-vuejs-todo-single-file-component
samples.title: Todo Client Web Part built with Vue.js and Vue's single-file components
samples.description: Sample Todo web part demonstrating how you can utilize Vue (a progressive framework for building user interfaces) with SharePoint Framework using handy single-file components approach.
